put down.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to put something or someone that you are holding or carrying onto a surface
put down.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Put those heavy bags down for a minute.
put down.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to criticize someone and make them feel silly or stupid
put down.translation[0].definitions[1].e: I hate the way Dave puts me down the whole time.
put down.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to write something, especially a name or number, on a piece of paper or on a list
put down.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Put down your name and address.
put down.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to stop a revolution etc by using force
put down.translation[0].definitions[3].e: The uprising was put down by the police and the army.
put down.translation[0].definitions[4].d: to pay part of the total cost of something, so that you can pay the rest later
put down.translation[0].definitions[4].e: They put down a deposit on the goods until Christmas.
put down.translation[0].definitions[5].d: to put a baby in its bed
put down.translation[0].definitions[5].e: We try to put Amy down at six every evening.
put down.translation[0].definitions[6].d: to put the receiver back onto the telephone when you have finished speaking to someone
put down.translation[0].definitions[6].e: She put the phone down on me  (=suddenly ended the conversation).
put down.translation[0].definitions[7].d: to kill an animal without causing it pain, usually because it is old or sick
put down.translation[0].definitions[7].e: We had to have the dog put down.
put down.translation[0].definitions[8].d: used to say that you found a book, game etc extremely interesting
put down.translation[0].definitions[8].e: Once I’d started reading it I just couldn’t put it down.
put down.translation[0].definitions[9].d: if an aircraft puts down or if a pilot puts it down, it lands, especially because of an emergency
put down.translation[0].definitions[9].e: The engine failed and the plane put down in the sea.
